documents.document: RT @FlamingIdiot1: @DavidHarewood @DuncanMack149 US may have more senior black figures but they r still more likely to suffer police brutal…

RT @faizashaheen: A black child is 12 times less likely to become PM than a white child, why does this matter? My blog https://t.co/1nA509A…
@DavidHarewood Thank you for educating people. There's still a long way to go. The structure of wealth and privilege needs breaking down.
"The system is structured in such a way that it favours wealth and privilege above all others" 👏🏽👏🏽 #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister
Essential watching on BBC2 #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister. @DavidHarewood is compelling and incisive. I loved the expose! 👦🏾👏🏽👦🏿👏🏽
"The British system is elitist and it has to change": @DavidHarewood on #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister. I totally agree! ♥️
@faizashaheen Loved your insight on #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister. Thanks for educating us. I've tweeted #Oxford wanting answers!
@UniofOxford When will you stop choosing your students based on where they went to school? #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister
@UniofOxford What are you going to do about your clear lack on engagement with inner city schools? #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister
@UniofOxford Why are you refusing to engage with the #BBC? It smacks of elitism and breathtaking arrogance don't you think? #blackandbritish
@UniofOxford brushed off #BBC request for an interview. Elitist much? 🙄 #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister
#WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister shows that the greatest privilege of all is #WealthPrivilege. The school stats are astonishing 😳
Aisha the Oxford hopeful seems almost embarrassed at being black. Be proud girl, it's a good thing! #WillBritainEverHaveABlackPrimeMinister
